body:
Why are guilds with admin designated "offensive" content now opt-in instead of opt-out?

@captainmeta4 @kek

If you believe this is the right course of action, fine... but how can you justify an opt in instead of an opt out?

Same goes for politics. You are censoring what people can see by default - you cannot rule out that users may not be aware you are hiding content with this opt in method.

This is not what you stated Ruqqus would be about. What happened to shining a light and challenging controversial opinions, not letting them fester in the dark?

Why are you abandoning your stated principles now?

This should NOT be OPT IN. It should ONLY be OPT-OUT.

Why are guilds with admin designated "offensive" content now opt-in instead of opt-out?

@captainmeta4 @kek

This is not what you stated Ruqqus would be about. What happened to shining a light and challenging controversial opinions, not letting them fester in the dark?

Why are you abandoning your stated principles now?

This should NOT be OPT IN. It should ONLY be OPT-OUT.

post.body:
Why are guilds with admin designated "offensive" content now opt-in instead of opt-out?

@captainmeta4 @kek

If you believe this is the right course of action, fine... but how can you justify an opt in instead of an opt out?

Same goes for politics. You are censoring what people can see by default - you cannot rule out that users may not be aware you are hiding content with this opt in method.

This is not what you stated Ruqqus would be about. What happened to shining a light and challenging controversial opinions, not letting them fester in the dark?

Why are you abandoning your stated principles now?

This should NOT be OPT IN. It should ONLY be OPT-OUT.

body:
Suppose someone refused to mark content as NSFW/NSFL when it is. Would you support the admins marking it as such?  Because this is sort of like that.  The category basically describes the entire guild as NSFW. A guild like +imgoingtohellforthis pretty clearly fits the Offensive/NSFW category. If that guild were to label itself as a family friendly guild, should something be done about it?

Or to put it more succinctly, do people on Ruqqus have the right to misrepresent what type of content they are posting?

Do other people on ruqqus have the right to sort and filter content? And if so, how does that work if content is not required to be appropriately labeled?

I'm not sure what the solution is. It seems like nothing is perfect and every approach has tradeoffs.

body:
No worries. Thatâ€™s nice to hear. Iâ€™d like to think Iâ€™m one of the staunchest people on no censorship. Iâ€™ve never compromised on my policy of no exiles. 

This categories things has broken Ruqqus and now many guilds I was posting in are broken and my posts there are invisible. This hurts the many small guilds that probably had no gms, but might have had some new person take them over if people were seen to be posting there. Iâ€™d lend them my hand myselfâ€”but the guild management limit. Iâ€™ve always thought the complaining about diversity and apportionment of the top of trending was dumb. I donâ€™t always like whatâ€™s on there and wish things from uplifting news for example were more visible, but Iâ€™ve never wanted a finger on the scale. Everyone deserves a space. And the ability to have their content seen. O admins have you forgotten that the_Donald was removed from r/all and signaled the censorship of reddit? I donâ€™t have a problem with the admins creating a page for new users with their personal favorite Ruqqus guilds to recommend or something, as long as trending and new Are Exactly as they are. What is real and popular with users. And that can also be seen for users. Disclaimer: new king users of Ruqqus you Will see content you disagree with here. Thatâ€™s Because Ruqqus doesnâ€™t censor or hide it or deboost it. Because people have the Freedom to talk as they wish.

This is not what you stated Ruqqus would be about. What happened to shining a light and challenging controversial opinions, not letting them fester in the dark?

Why are you abandoning your stated principles now?

This should NOT be OPT IN. It should ONLY be OPT-OUT.
